description:
Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse is a follow-up to Shin Megami Tensei IV, taking place in the same setting, and with its plot acting as a follow up to the Neutral path of the previous game.

The story is set in the year 2038, in Tokyo, where a raging war occurred between the gods 25 years ago, resulting in the sky above the city being covered in rock, in order to avoid contact with the outside world. Even after the war ended, the world is still devoid of normality, with people killing each other, and Man being ruled over by both angels and demons. The player takes control of the character Nanashi, who after being killed almost at the start of the game, is revived by the demon Dagda, in return for becoming Dagda's "Godslayer".

The game then slowly directs the player through the usual Shin Megami Tensei alignment system, where decisions made will border on either Law, Chaos or Neutral routes, which will lead to a multitude of different endings.

There are several key gameplay changes in this game, comparing it to its sister title, Shin Megami Tensei IV:

  • The expanded partner system is the most obvious improvement, with Nanashi being able to have up to seven partners during battle (the usual 3 demons to fight alongside him, as well as 4 support characters, each with their own support gauge);
  • Update to the negotiation system, where previously failed negotiations will start where they left off if you try them again, instead of simply restarting all over;
  • Enhancements to magic usage, whereby demons specializing in a certain magic type will use it more efficiently;
  • Also regarding magic, the light and dark spells of Hama and Mudo no longer have the possibility of instantly killing an opponent, they now deal damage instead;
  • Complete overhaul to the UI, making it a lot more user friendly and aesthetically pleasing;
  • New sound effects (like demon roaring).

Some demon designs from the previous game were refined in this release, and the main character was given a teenager look in order to better fit the game's themes (instead of the original design, which made him look much older).
title: Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse

description:
Super Mario Maker for Nintendo 3DS is a port of the Wii U game, Super Mario Maker, allowing players to create and play their own Mario platform game levels, as well as play through many other previously-created ones.

The most drastic difference between this game and the original is the fact that the 3DS version does not allow for the players to upload the courses they create on the Internet. Players can, however, share their courses with each other via StreetPass or Local Play.

The game comes with 100 exclusive courses, not available in the Wii U version. These courses have different goals (like collecting every coin in the level, for instance), which will earn the player medals upon completion.

Almost every other aspect of the game remains the same as its Wii U counterpart, aside from a few details such as the absence of some small elements (like the Big Mushrooms and the Gnat Attack minigame).

Even though it is a 3DS title, the game does not feature stereoscopic 3D.
title: Super Mario Maker for Nintendo 3DS

description:
Spirit Camera: The Cursed Memoir is a survival horror game and a spin-off from the Fatal Frame series. The game utilizes the AR functionality of the 3DS to interact with the provided AR Notebook ("The Diary of Faces" (USA) / "The Purple Diary" (Europe)).

The game starts with the player receiving the above mentioned AR Book, on which the player has a creepy and sinister feeling about the whole aura around the book. Creepy pictures, strange and cryptic words. Blank pages suddenly filling themselves with texts. The game can be generally categorized into three sections:

Story Mode (Diary of Faces/Purple Diary): The main mode, in which the 3DS camera is used as Camera Obscura to find hints within the diary and battle ghosts in the real world environment around them. The main goal is to aid the trapped female ghost Maya in the diary and help her escape her troublesome fate. This mode is split up in sections, which can be accessed from the main menu when unlocked. Clearing Story Mode unlocks an outfit for Maya, Story Mode (Extra), and Battle mode.

Story Mode (Extra): This is a more difficult version of story mode, unlocked after clearing the standard Story Mode.

Battle Mode: This mode after being unlocked is a mode in which the player can freely take photographs of the world around him and battle characters appearing in story mode. Clearing battles in this mode adds a new costume and new battles.

Ghost Camera: This mode can be played in a total of three different ways. Using the 3DS' camera to take photos of the player's surroundings will result in images of ghosts appearing in the pictures. Players can also "diagnose" someone as being haunted, by taking a photo of the player or other people, which will reveal an image of the "ghost" haunting them. Players can also take photographs of their own face or the faces of others and put them onto a ghost's body.

Horror Notebook: In this mode, the player must use the 3DS camera to search through the AR Notebook to find the ghost of the Masked Boy hiding within it, which will trigger a mini-game. The other known game in this mode is "Curse of the Japanese Dolls", in which the player must correctly identify the real doll out of a group, and photograph it to exorcise it within the time limit.
title: Spirit Camera: The Cursed Memoir

description:
Solve pixel puzzles by tapping numbered blocks to extend them into lines. At the start of each puzzle most of the blocks on the screen are empty, while some are filled. Some of the filled blocks contain numbers, which indicate to the player the length of the line that must extend from them. The player must select a numbered block and a cardinal direction in which to extend a line. Each line will extend until it hits a filled block (such as another numbered block or line), exceeding the intended length, so the player must carefully extend lines in the correct order.

Once all blocks have been extended, the colours and shapes of the lines reveal a pixel image. While recognising the image as it is revealed can help guide the player, only logic is necessary to solve the puzzle.
title: Tappingo

description:
Captain Olimar wakes up after crash landing his ship, and realizing that the fuel supply is empty. After wandering about, he comes across some Pikmin hidden around, and eventually some Sparklium seeds, which are what is used as fuel for the ship, and thus, needed for escaping.

In Hey! Pikmin, a spinoff of the Pikmin series, the player controls Captain Olimar, in a 2.5D side-scroller with puzzle elements, instead of the traditional 3D real-time strategy that the series goes by.

Pikmin are found in the wild, and Captain Olimar can call upon them with his whistle, and then issue several different commands, such as throw them onto platforms, so they can remove obstacles and collect items. Olimar is controlled with the D-pad, while Pikmin are controlled with the stylus. As such, the game relies heavily on the touchscreen. Each Pikmin type has different abilities – for instance, blue Pikmin can swim, red Pikmin are resistant to fire, and yellow Pikmin are resistant to electricity. The player must then utilize different Pikmin to suit different situations.

Captain Olimar has a set of green bars depicting his health, which are depleted by simply bumping into enemies, instead of just by enemy attacks, like in previous games.
title: Hey! Pikmin

alternate_titles.title: Nintendo presenta: New Style Boutique 2 − Sempre più fashion!
Nintendo presenta: New Style Boutique 2 − ¡Marca tendencias!
Nintendo presents: New Style Boutique 2 − Fashion Forward
Nintendo präsentiert: New Style Boutique 2 − Mode von morgen
Nintendo présente: La Nouvelle Maison du Style 2 − Les reines de la mode

description:
On your 16th birthday a letter from your grandmother arrives, containing a note and a key. This magic key unlocks the plastic door of a diorama, and out steps a doll-sized girl. After talking to the girl Sophie she realizes that your grandmother was the fashionista known by everyone in her town as the woman who could make people happy with fashion. She then invites you back into her world, to see the clothing store grandma used to run.

Syle Savvy: Fashion Forward is a further expansion of the Style Savvy series, containing the same dressup gameplay as past entries with new features to free your inner stylist. The core gameplay, and money-making component, is still based around selling clothes from the boutique. Customers browsing the boutique can be talked to to see what item they are looking for. If the player accepts the request they're taken to the backstock, where they try to match the customer's request, and the style of their other clothing. Customers all have a budget too, but can be persuaded to go slightly over it if they fall in love with the item. A customer's first request will be for a single item, but once they trust the player enough they will request a complete outfit, with a higher budget to match. All of the store's inventory has to be purchased beforehand by the player, which they will get at the Exhibition hall. Each clothing brand, who all specialize in a particular style, has a store in the hall, with a selection that rotates daily and is seasonal. Whenever a new item is purchased the player also receives a personal copy of it for their wardrobe. The interior, exterior, and window display of the boutique can all be customized, and will determine what sort of customers are attracted inside.

In addition to the boutique there are also a variety of side-jobs that can be taken on, such as the beautician, hairstylist, and modeling studio. The beautician and hairstylist take requests from customers the same as the boutique, and successful makeup and haircuts can be saved for future use. At the modeling studio the player can select from available gigs, put together an appropriate outfit for the job, then go on location to get the pose and shot that evokes the customer's demands. The game can take 2d or 3d screenshots at any time, and beyond just saving memories these photos can be given to the color expert and makeup kit designers to inspire them. New colors unlocked this way can be used for makeup, hairdye, and clothing design dyes.

Dressup, makeup, and hairstyling all come together for the fashion show, where the player has to match a theme with multiple outfits. If the fashion show goes well new customers will come into the shop, looking for a complete makeover from the local celebrity herself.

After completing the main storyline the clothing brands will be so impressed by the player's style sense that they will commission limited runs of new clothing. Each request will be for a specific kind of item, such as a bridal dress or a clutch, and then a requirement for the item's design. By talking to people in town the player can learn new patterns and accessories, and once a request is completed that same clothing style will be unlocked to make custom designs on the player's dime.

A new feature for Fashion Forward is the dollhouse, a magical building that turns doll furniture into full-size rooms. Each dollhouse room can be customized to the player's wishes, or designed around a theme, like cafe or boutique. New doll furniture can be purchased or received as gifts from characters in town, and if a room is impressive enough characters may ask to rent it.

If Streetpass is activated the game will share a selected dollhouse room with other 3DSes. The game also supports Amiibos, and scanning Amiibos from select (mostly female) Nintendo characters will summon a customer based on the system's Mii who is looking for an outfit to match their style. Completing their request will reward a unique item, like a Kirby purse or Lucinda's skirt, to the player's wardrobe.

The Japanese version of Fashion Forward had free, monthly updates that added seasonal clothing as well as clothing based on actual clothing brands. For the European and North American release the majority of seasonal items were rolled into the base game, and the licensed clothes not included. Unlike Trendsetters the boutique will not get male customers, but once the main storyline is completed the menu will have an option to dressup any male character in the game.
title: Style Savvy: Fashion Forward

description:
Radiant Historia: Perfect Chronology is a remake of the original Nintendo DS title Radiant Historia, with added game play and story elements as well as updated visuals and character art. This version also adds a new sub-plot called Possible History, and five new music tracks.

The game takes place on a war-torn continent known as Vainqueur. In order to prevent the continent to becoming a harsh and barren desert, The protagonist, Stocke, must make use of a magical tome to travel between multiple timelines in order to alter the desert fate of Vainqueur. Using this ability, as well as a colorful cast of party members, the player uses grid-based battlefield with a turn-based combat system to take on the enemies who are out to prevent the protagonist from changing the fate of the doomed continent. With the addition of the "Possible History" content in this edition, the player can explore alternate timelines with a new party member that can affect the main timeline.
title: Radiant Historia: Perfect Chronology

description:
Kirby’s Blowout Blast is based on Kirby 3D Rumble, which is a mini-game in Kirby: Planet Robobot. The game follows the same mechanics as the original Kirby game, Kirby's Dream Land, meaning there is no copy ability, like in future iterations of the series. The main difference in Kirby’s Blowout Blast is the introduction of the 3D environment, which changes the gameplay around. For instance, Kirby can now spit enemies he has swallowed in several different directions, with the introduction of a small arrow to indicate the direction Kirby will spit the enemy out.

Even though the game is fully playable in 2D, the use of the 3D gimmick gives the world a much greater sense of depth, and can sometimes help with the gameplay, just like it happened in Planet Robobot.

Each completed stage awards the player with bonus points, depending on how fast the stage was finished, how many enemies were killed, if all coins were collected and if damage was avoided. A gold ranking (or higher) will unlock the EX versions of the corresponding world, and since there are initially five worlds to beat, obtaining that rank in each single world will double the game’s length, making 10 worlds available.

Kirby themed Amiibo work with the game, unlocking several cosmetic extras. Other extras are also unlocked by having Kirby Planet Robobot.
title: Kirby's Blowout Blast

description:
SPEC is a text-adventure game based on the TV drama series with the same name, featuring the same actors from the TV series. Most of the game resembles a typical visual novel showing static characters in different poses and expressions over background with on-screen text to indicate dialogues with included voice-acting. Unlike in visual novels where both background and characters often use anime art, this game uses actual locations and live photos for both locations and characters. The bottom, touch screen, is used to enter player's responses during dialogues, check conversation log, adjust the game settings, save the game or check the tips and hints section.

The story takes place between episode 4 and 5 of the TV drama and features Takeru and Saya as the protagonists. The SPEC is a special police investigation branch that focuses on catching people who abuse their supernatural abilities. The story, as such, takes place in slightly altered version of the real world where people with special abilities exist, and those abilities are not clearly visible to anyone else unless the person who has a special ability uses it. Takeru and Saya, a team of two young detectives, confronts the criminals who use their special abilities to do evil deeds.

Initial print release included a download code for new scenarios which can also be purchased via in-app after completing the main story. Additionally, the game includes a retro mystery adventure game which uses 8-bit graphic and controls similar to old Famicom (NES) adventure games with static image depicting location on one part of screen, and the other containing a list of actions player can perform to either investigate the location or talk to other characters.
title: SPEC: Kan

description:
What are the top minigames that stand out in the main Mario Party series? Nintendo answers this question by officially providing 100 remastered minigames spanning from the first through tenth main installments. This game focuses more on the minigames already created rather than the main board game aspect or storyline.

In "100 Minigames," the player can select one of minigames to play. At the start, only some of the 100 are available. "Minigame Island" enables the player to unlock additional minigames by progressing through four sections of the entire map. "Minigame Match " has players compete in a small game board, while still emphasizing the minigames. In "Championship Battles," players can compete for the most wins in three or five minigames. "Decathlon" allows players to test how well they do overall in five or ten certain minigames. "Collection" lets players look at what they won or unlocked, between music, artifacts, and characters. "Play with Friends" helps players enable local multiplayer experiences, either with one or all players containing a cartridge.
title: Mario Party: The Top 100

description:
Kōenji Joshi Soccer 3 is the third game in the soccer-themed visual novel focusing on the girls-only soccer team of Kouenji Academy. The story takes place seven years after the events that took place in Kōenji Joshi Soccer 2 where the player's team won the world championship. Now that team is a legend and talk in school, but it is becoming the thing of the past and the soccer team is about to be abolished. The player takes on a role of a newly transferred coach who has been given an opportunity to assemble a new team and train the girls to win the tournament.

While being focused on soccer on training, the game gives you a one day event that lets you make private memories with each of the heroines. The story unfolds from April to January and is being split into monthly events where the soccer practice and interaction with characters takes place. While the dialogues and visual novel scenes use typical 2D anime character art over static backgrounds, the soccer practice sessions use 3D terrain and SD character style. Each of the 11 soccer team member heroines have both school uniforms and soccer uniforms which they switch during practice time.

Assembling the team of girls with different personalities is one challenge, making them work as a team furthers the difficulty, but overcoming the obstacles and making them work together is what makes the team strong, and their coordination and tactic fluid and skilled enough to achieve the victory. The soccer part of the game is somewhat turn-based and lets you choose action after each pass of the ball. Each of the girls have the parameters which determine the chance of success of performing a certain move. Some girl is better at passing or dribbling or shooting than the other, so it is imperative to rely on that in order to score the goal and win the match. Performing an action depletes part of the stamina, and as the stamina goes down, so does the chance of success of performing an action. All girls will level up after a match. No matter the victory or defeat, their skill parameters will increase.

Soccer team heroines, and their field positions, include:

  • FW - Miku Asuka (飛鳥 未来)
  • FW - Lola Itabashi (板橋 ローラ)
  • MF - Mai Kiyamachi (木屋町 舞)
  • MF - Shinobu Igano (伊賀野 忍)
  • MF - Moe Urahara (浦原 萌)
  • MF - Mue Sawamura (沢村 夢絵)
  • DF - Rei Arino (有野 玲)
  • DF - Sumire Paru (羽流 純連)
  • DF - Guguru Andou (安藤 ぐぐる)
  • DF - Rua Shiga (滋賀 瑠亜)
  • GK - Mahiro Motoyama (本山 まひろ)
title: Kōenji Joshi Soccer 3: Koisuru Eleven Itsuka wa Heaven

description:
Ozawa Rina, a touch detective, and her assistant Nameko, are back for the third time on yet another case. This time in 3D mode on 3DS instead of NDS as the first two games. The gameplay is mainly the same, the player controls Rina character in 3rd-person perspective using point-and-touch interface. Rina can pick up items and add them to her inventory, talk to other characters and check various objects in the ares she's in by touching them. Collected items can be more closely examined and interacted with, while some can be combined with other items.

Similar to hint coins in Professor Layton games, this game has name-coins (Japanese "name", not English word "name") which are hidden at various spots not visible to the naked eye and will require player to randomly touch and check hidden places for such coins. Name-coins too, just as in Professor Layton games are used for hints. Rina also carries her info book with her where she adds info about characters she meets.Aside for hints, name-coins can also be used in lottery which lets you collect Nameko figurines and completing a full set yields a reward.
title: Osawari Tantei Ozawa Rina: Rising 3 - Nameko wa Banana no Yumewomiru ka?

description:
Arle Nadja has been through a lot of crazy adventures before, but nothing quite like this! On a peaceful day in Primp Town, Arle and her good friend Carbuncle were enjoying the day, when all of a sudden, a book with a moon and sun dropped from the sky and transported the dynamic duo into a strange new world! Why? As it turns out, she's the so-called "Great Hero" of this particular world. But there's no time for dilly-dallying... Arle, aided by an adventurer named Ally, and a host of other friends that also got sucked in, may as well high-tail it to the tower if she's to fulfill her destiny in this world... and to make it back to hers.

Puyo Puyo Chronicle is a puzzle/RPG set in the Puyo Puyo universe where Arle Nadja and a host of other allies must fight through a world full of monsters to save it from total destruction. Battles are fought in a variation of standard Puyo Puyo fashion: attack enemies by making chains, while at the same time trying to alternately conserve health and avoid getting swamped in Nuisance Puyo! Winning battles gains experience and levels up the party, which makes characters stronger. In addition, a series of side quests can be completed, with wonderful rewards awaiting at the end.

Of course, it wouldn't be a Puyo Puyo game without the Battle Mode, where up to 4 players face each other in a fight to the last.
title: Puyo Puyo Chronicle

description: Based on the 2014 Michael Bay movie of the same name, the heroes in the half-shell are back to save the world! Play as either Leonardo, Raphael, Donatello and Michelangelo in this action packed game, using many kinds of different special skills, such as Raphael's sheer amount of strentgh or Donatello's high intelligence. You can swap between each characters at any time.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

description:
Nyoki Nyoki is a falling block puzzle game created by Puyo Puyo producer Masamitsu Niitani in an attempt to create a competitive multiplayer puzzle game with a gentler learning curve to becoming skilled.

Like Puyo Puyo and Pochi and Nyaa, players drop coloured game pieces as they fall from the top of the screen. The cat-themed game pieces connect to each other and form visible chains as the player places pieces of the same colour next to each other. Unlike Puyo Puyo, chains don't trigger automatically when a certain number of pieces connect together; instead, the player can transform falling game pieces into combo-starters of the same colours at any time, allowing the player to build chains at their own pace or frantically pop pieces when they're in trouble.
title: Nyoki Nyoki: Tabidachi-hen

description: This single-player action/RPG is set in the MapleStory universe. Unlike MapleStory DS, the player controls one primary protagonist; the story follows the adventures of a girl named Mugi as she sets out on a journey through the world. Gameplay is a mix of side-scrolling 2D platforming and beat-em-up style combat; RPG elements allow the player to equip Mugi with various items to customize her. Certain other allies she can meet throughout the game can join her on her journey and become controllable for parts of the game.
title: MapleStory: Unmyeong-ui Sonyeo

description: The Fledgling Warriors Pack is downloadable content (DLC) for the 2017 game Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia adding two battle maps (Band of Bandages & Wretches and Riches) and one dungeon (The Astral Temple) to the game. Players will receive items, experience and gold upon completing the tasks involved.
title: Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia - Fledgling Warriors Pack

description: The Undaunted Heroes Pack is downloadable content (DLC) for the 2017 game Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia adding two battle maps (Lords of the Grave & Wealth Before health) and one dungeon (Inner Sanctum) to the game. Players will receive items, experience and gold upon completing the tasks involved.
title: Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia - Undaunted Heroes Pack

description: The Lost Altars Pack is downloadable content (DLC) for the 2017 game Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia and adds 10 altars to the game, upon which the player can level a character beyond it's maximum level. Each altar is designed for each of the available classes.
title: Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia - Lost Altars Pack

description: The Rise of the Deliverance Pack is downloadable content (DLC) for the 2017 game Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia adding four battle maps which serve as a prequel story before the start of Alm's tale, tracing the war waged by the Deliverance. The battle maps are: Battle of Zofia Harbor, Outpost Rescue, Flight from the Ruins and Siege of Zofia Castle.
title: Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia - Rise of the Deliverance Pack

description: The Fledgling Warriors Pack is downloadable content (DLC) for the 2017 game Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia adding two battle maps (Cipher Legend I & II), introducing two characters from the Japanese Fire Emblem: Cipher trading card game as a tie-in.
title: Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia - Cipher Companions Pack

description: This adaptation of the anime Tribe Cool Crew is a cross between a platform game and a rhythm game. Players take on the role of one of the show's dancers navigating through sidescrolling platform levels using breakdancing moves timed to input prompts. In between levels, players take part in more traditional music game segments.
title: Tribe Cool Crew: The G@me

description:
Downloadable content for Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies.

Turnabout Reclaimed takes place after the events of Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney. Phoenix Wright has just returned back to the profession of law and his first case back involves murder at an aquarium. Phoenix will have to defend his client of this charge, the client being one Ora Shipley, a killer whale.
title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies: Special Episode - Turnabout Reclaimed

description: This Radirgy spinoff takes the series in a new direction by mashing up the original game's shooter gameplay with tower defence. The player's ship is invincible, and the player spends their time defending a vulnerable structure at the bottom of the screen. The single level features increasingly frenetic waves of enemies to fend off.
title: Radirgy De Gojaru!

description:
This sequel to Illvelo plays like a cross between the original game and Radirgy. Like the original, Illvelo Dillinjah features surreal superflat artwork depicting the inside of a computer operating system and pounding techno music. The player has several ships to choose between. The TRAX is the ship from the original game, keeping its gameplay; the Kojiro plays like Radirgy, replacing the original game's unique support ships with a sword, letting the player choose between traditional shmup shooting and close-range attacks; and Deterrent the Naginata provides a variant on the Kojiro's gameplay.

Rather than a complete game, this plays like a compilation of the short hidden stages from the original game. These act as short challenge stages which must be completed quickly and precisely.
title: Illvelo Dillinjah

description: The characters of Persona 3, Persona 4, and Persona 5 explore four movie-themed labyrinths when they are thrown together into a mysterious theatre.
title: Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth

description:
The "Showtime" Premium Edition includes:

  • Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth
  • 5" Koromaru plush
  • Art book
  • Deck of 54 playing cards
  • Set of buttons featuring the four protagonists
title: Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth ("Showtime" Premium Edition)

alternate_titles.title: Sherlock Holmes: Geheimnis der gefrorenen Stadt

description:
Sherlock Holmes is called in to investigate a mysterious snowstorm so cold that even the Thames is starting to freeze.

The action takes place within a scientific exhibition, with different areas dedicated to different inventions. A weather machine has been sabotaged and you need to collect control crystals to end the storm. The game is split up into chapters, as you try to gather crystals, whilst also pursuing information leading to the culprit. Much of the machinery is inoperative, requiring you to gather parts to get them working again. This results in recurring scavenger hunting gameplay, as you scour the various available rooms for the missing items. More than 50 minigames appear throughout the game, including cracking lock combinations, placing cogs, and rearranging a pipe network.
title: Sherlock Holmes: The Mystery of the Frozen City

description:
Downloadable content for Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice.

Phoenix Wright: Asinine Attorney is a brief courtroom storyline in which the people in court are being held hostage by a Defiant Dragons rebel who insists of having Princess Rayfa handed over to him. This DLC also includes a 3DS theme.
title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice: Ace Attorney Theater - Phoenix Wright: Asinine Attorney

description:
Downloadable content for Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice.

Apollo Justice: Asinine Attorney is a brief courtroom storyline in which a mock trial is held to figure out if Princess Rayfa has a legit reason to stay on her visit or if she has to return back home to the Kingdom of Khura'in. This DLC also includes a 3DS theme.
title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice: Ace Attorney Theater - Apollo Justice: Asinine Attorney

description:
Downloadable content for Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice.

Phoenix Wright takes on the case of Ellen Wyatt, the fiance of Sorin Sprocket, who is accused of murdering Dumas Gloomsbury. The prosecutor of the case is Phoenix's longtime frenemy Miles Edgeworth.
title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice: Special Episode - Turnabout Time Traveler

description:
Theatrhythm: Dragon Quest is the third game in the Theatrhythm series and the first one to focus on the Dragon Quest franchise.

The player takes control of a party of four warriors battling through songs from the Dragon Quest franchise. The gameplay features both vertical and horizontal scrolling stages, where markers move in from one end of the screen towards the other. When the marker overlaps your target marker it's time to either press a button or move the stick in the way designated by the marker. The game also includes a "Simple Mode" that reduces the variation of inputs down to just button taps for those that find the game too challenging.

There are 65 songs to pick from and could be extended by DLC from the Nintendo eShop.

The game features three main game modes:

Music Mode - Play through play your unlocked songs in the true and tested Theatrhythm style. Challenge Mode - Clear challenges set to unlock more songs for the game. Sugoroku Mode - A Boardgame style mode where you try to race to the end of the board by throwing a dice, facing challenges along the way. This mode grants you gems that can be spent to unlock more characters.
title: Theatrhythm: Dragon Quest

description:
Haikyu!! Tsunage! Itadaki no Keshiki!! is a volleyball game based on the anime and manga series Haikyu!!. Rather than an action sports game, it is a tactical strategy game with turn-based gameplay to manage the squad with the individual players to beat opponents in matches.

The game can be played in a Game or Adventure mode. Players must converse in the adventure mode and communicate with other characters. The tale can vary from the original series based on the role the player wants to manage, as new plot lines activate. In the game mode, the players can compete against opposing teams in volleyball matches.

Also included is a Final Haikyu Quest mode, which takes the players and places them in a traditional RPG itself (similar to Dragon Quest). Instead of their team uniform, characters assume looks identical to RPG classes.
title: Haikyū!! Tsunage! Itadaki no Keshiki!!

description:
In Haikyū!! Cross Team Match! the player takes on the part of the lead and only volleyball team player of Momojihara High School. The protagonist attends a Karasuno conducted joint rehearsal and communicates with characters from Haikyuu's mange/anime universe. Based on the interactions players can then be hired to form a squad.

In certain situations a special event occurs such as a practice game to hire someone, or the appearance of a special item when the confidence meter gets to a certain level. Matches are largely determined by the players' statistics, but they are played in real-time. Prompts appear to quickly select a specific player, for instance for the reception, and lines are drawn for other types of moves.

There is an additional plot called Shimada Mart after the player finishes the main story.
title: Haikyū!! Cross Team Match!
Yakari: The Mystery of Four Seasons
City Skaters: Run Boy, Run Girl!

description:
3in1 Horses is a compilation containing the following three games on one cartridge:

  • My Riding Stables 3D: Jumping for the Team
  • My Western Horse 3D
  • Riding Star 3D
title: 3in1 Horses: My Riding Stables 3D - Jumping for the Team + Riding Star 3D + My Western Horse 3D

description: Yo-kai Sangokushi is a spin-off of the Yo-kai Watch series for the Nintendo 3DS. It is a collaborative game between Koei Tecmo and Level-5. It is based of Koei Tecmo's Romance of Three Kingdoms series. The game is a turn-based tactical role-playing game, but with the character having rankings, like in Yo-kai Watch 2. The main protagonist is chosen by the player, which are Jibanyan, Komasan, and USApyon. The game starts with Jibanyan and Komasan exploring a library. While they are reading a mysterious book, they were suddenly pulled inside of the story. They are soon followed by USApyon, and depending on which the player picked in the beginning the story is different.
title: Yo-kai Sangokushi
Horrid Henry: The Good, The Bad & The Bugly

description:
Daigasso! Band Brothers P is a music game in Japanese.

The game contains a variety of different instruments, which are combined selectively in order to compose a song. Among multiple kinds of instruments, one player chooses one instrument to play it by press correct button at certain time point, just like other music games. That is the origin of the game series' title: "Daigasso" means "Grand ensemble" in Japanese. The game primarily focuses on multiplayer.

Besides the songs included initially within the game, players can compose their own songs and share them to other players' Nintendo 3DS console through local wireless network.

Before the game server's closure on May 1, 2020, players were able to download and purchase songs from the game server using the in-game fictitious currency "tomato", or play instrument with other players online. Before March 21, 2017, players was also able to upload songs composed by themselves to the game server.
title: Daigasso! Band-Brothers P

description:
A compilation that includes:

  • Jewel Link: Atlantic Quest
  • Jewel Link: Safari Quest
title: Jewel Link Double Pack: Safari Quest / Atlantic Quest

description: Battle of Elemental REBOOST is an enhanced rerelease of the DSi original featuring updated artwork and new elements. Like the original game, it's effectively a fantasy take on the classic Virtual On; players battle each other in one-on-one matches in a 3D arena with the camera behind their character, using a combination of ranged and melee attacks to control space and take down the enemy. The new version takes advantage of the 3DS's hardware to improve the quality of character models. It also adds a new survival mode, where players take on CPU-controlled enemies one after another for as long as they can, and an online versus mode.
title: Battle of Elemental REBOOST

description: Boku wa Kōkū Kanseikan: Airport Hero 3D - Kankū All Stars (literally translated as "I Am an Air Traffic Controller: Airport Hero 3D - Kansai International Airport All Stars") is an air traffic controller simulation game. Players need to direct planes to land, taxi, take off and change flying direction.
title: Boku wa Kōkū Kanseikan: Airport Hero 3D - Kankū All Stars

description: Hatsune Miku: Project Mirai 2 is a rhythm game featuring Vocaloid virtual singers, including Hatsune Miku, Kagamine Rin and Len, Megurine Luka, Kaito, Meiko and Gumi. Due to the low display resolution of Nintendo 3DS, the game adopted Nendoroid Chibi models originated by Good Smile Company. The game is the base of Hatsune Miku: Project Mirai DX.
title: Hatsune Miku: Project Mirai 2

description:
Monster Hunter 4 is a hunting action game.

In the game, players slay monsters, get ingredients from their bodies, and use the ingredients to craft and upgrade weapons and armors for slaying more powerful monsters. In comparison with previous games in Monster Hunter series, the most significant new element is difference in height, which allows player to climb up and jump down in 3-Dimensional maps. It also introduces 2 kinds of new weapons, i.e. the Insect Glaive and the Charge Blade.

It is the base of Monster Hunter 4: Ultimate.
title: Monster Hunter 4

description: Gundam: The 3D Battle is a 3D action game based on the Japanese anime meta-series Gundam. It is mainly based on Mobile Suit Gundam movie series, Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam movie series and Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack, but also contains Mobile Suits from Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn as guest appearance.
title: Gundam: The 3D Battle

description:
Medarot Classics collects together five different games in the Medarot (aka Medabots) series for the Game Boy and Game Boy Color. All of the original games in this compilation were originally released in two different versions; this compilation features the Kabuto Version variants of each included game. The included games are:

  • Medarot
  • Medarot 2
  • Medarot 3
  • Medarot 4
  • Medarot 5: Susutake Mura no Tenkousei
title: Medarot Classics: Kabuto Version

description:
Medarot Classics collects together five different games in the Medarot (aka Medabots) series for the Game Boy and Game Boy Color. All of the original games in this compilation were originally released in two different versions; this compilation features the Kuwagata Version variants of each included game. The included games are:

  • Medarot
  • Medarot 2
  • Medarot 3
  • Medarot 4
  • Medarot 5: Susutake Mura no Tenkousei
title: Medarot Classics: Kuwagata Version

description: This deluxe special edition collects together the retail Kabuto Version and Kuwagata Version editions of Medarot Classics along with an art book detailing the game's many characters and a soundtrack CD.
title: Medarot Classics: 20th Anniversary Edition

description:
In AKB48+Me, your objective is to have your custom Mii join the titular Idol group. By managing her weekly schedule (Including Singing skill, Dancing skill, and Conversational skill.) doing performances with the team, and customizing her clothing, book-ended with lengthy dialogue sequences starring every member of the group at the time of release.

Performances resemble the typical rhythm game on the system, by following the on-screen commands. You tap, slide, and spin the touch screen in time to the music. Attempting to earn enough points to cross the score bar.

Watching performances is also an option, using whatever Miis and outfits you'd prefer. You can even have them perform in real-life using the included AR card.
title: AKB48+Me

description:
This special edition contains:

  • Radiant Historia: Perfect Chronology
  • Art book
  • Decal sheet
title: Radiant Historia: Perfect Chronology (Launch Edition)

description: Sengoku Musō: Chronicle 2nd is the 2nd entry in Samurai Warriors: Chronicles series. Although numbered "2nd", the game is actually an enhanced version of Samurai Warriors: Chronicles. It adds more playable characters and storylines along with other improvements to its base game.
title: Sengoku Musō: Chronicle 2nd

description: Virus Shooter XX is an augmented reality (AR) game makes use of Nintendo 3DS's camera and gyroscope. Players need to move their hardware in order to shoot the viruses shown in the screen.
title: Virus Shooter XX

description:
Bikkuriman Kanjuku Haō: Sanmi Dōran Sensōki is a card battle game. It is basically a digital translation of the collectible card game Bikkuriman Kanjuku Haō.

In the game, every card features a Kanji (i.e. Chinese character in Japanese). The battle rules are based on numbers of strokes of Kanji. The player who plays cards with a greater number of strokes will become defensive, which is advantageous in this game, in the next round. Players can play one or more cards within a round, while playing multiple cards is allowed only when Kanji on the cards can be combined into a word. The winner is the player who plays all of his cards first.
title: Bikkuriman Kanjuku Haō: Sanmi Dōran Sensōki

description: Dopamix is a surreal, abstract rhythm game. Coloured dots move around the screen, and players are required to tap the right button when they overlap with a target marker. The game is themed around "dopamine", with the game allegedly designed to help players' brains release dopamine.
title: Dopamix

description:
This special edition includes:

  • Corpse Party
  • Two 2.5” tall figurines
  • A music soundtrack CD
title: Corpse Party: Back to School Edition

description: Ochaken to Itsumo Nakayoshi is a virtual pet game based on the Sega Toys Ochaken line, which features cute dogs with tea leaves for ears. Players adopt their own ochaken and raise them, with many ways of interacting with them using touch-based controls and a variety of activities. Compared to the earlier Ochaken games by MTO, this game has a reduced focus on interior decorating but more detail in the player's interactions with their pets.
title: Ochaken to Itsumo Nakayoshi

description: Nameko Rhythm is a spinoff of the Osawari Tantei (Touch Detective) series where the characters dance instead of solve mysteries. Nameko (Funghi) leads the rhythm on the touchscreen; players must tap the different Nameko icons to the beat in order to dance. Performing well lets the player earn new songs and new outfits for Rina (Mackenzie).
title: Osawari Tantei Ozawa Rina: Nameko Rhythm

description: Nazo Waku Yakata: Oto no Manimani (literally translated as "The Mansion of Confusing Puzzles: at the Ｍercy of Sound") is a game which features voice recognition. Although there are some stages which require conventional controls (e.g. touching the bottom screen or press some button), most of the time players need to speak to the Nintendo 3DS's microphone in order to interact with the game.
title: Nazo Waku Yakata: Oto no Manimani

description:
Gon the unstoppable little dinosaur is back for another adventure. Searching for the mysterious "fabled fruit", he charges around the whole island and lets no animal or obstacle get in his way.

The game is a 2D platformer with a focus on eating. Gon constantly needs to find food to keep his hunger meter from draining, which would lead to a quick game over. He is otherwise practically invincible, and enemies or obstacles can only stun him for a short time. Boss fights are also centered around food, with the player being tasked to eat more food than the other characters within a time limit.

There is some minor use of 3DS hardware features like the 3D screen and gyro controls, allowing Gon to look into the 3D background of a stage by pressing R, where he can look for objects to interact with, or hidden animals in various situations which act as collectibles.
title: Gon: Baku Baku Baku Baku Adventure

description:
This special release contains the following:

  • A pre-installed New Super Mario Bros 2. The Gold Edition of the game comes with all ten of the previously released DLC for the game, adding up to 30 additional coin rush courses to play through.
  • A red colored Nintendo 3DS XL
title: Nintendo 3DS XL: New Super Mario Bros 2 - Gold Edition (included game)

description:
Downloadable content for Mario Golf: World Tour.

Contains two graphically updated Mario Golf courses:

  • Toad Highlands
  • Koopa Park

Also adds the character Toadette as a playable golfer.

description:
Downloadable content for Mario Golf: World Tour.

Contains two graphically updated Mario Golf courses:

  • Layer-Cake Desert
  • Sparkling Waters

Also adds the character Nabbit as a playable golfer.

description:
Downloadable content for Mario Golf: World Tour.

Contains two graphically updated Mario Golf courses:

  • Rock-Candy Mines
  • Mario's Star

Also adds the character Rosalina as a playable golfer..
title: Mario Golf: World Tour - Star Pack

description:
Orbs mysteriously started appearing around the Mushroom Kingdom and Princess Peach has been abducted by Bowser. After Mario receives a letter from Bowser daring him to come to his castle, Mario is now off to rescue the princess.

Puzzle & Dragons: Super Mario Bros. Edition is a tile-based puzzle game with combat. Unlike other Puzzle & Dragons games, the Mario Edition is more streamlined with a focus more on puzzle battles than story.

Before a battle begins players select their team, with Mario or Luigi as the leader, 4 Mushroom Kingdom creatures, and a toad ally. While the game uses tile-based matching, the game has a unique orb shifting gameplay element. Players can slide an orb to anywhere on the playfield in order to make a match or a combination of matches. Matching elements the same color as a team member lets that team member attack one enemy. Matching 5 of the same element lets a team member hit an entire group of enemies,

5 different orb elements exist, with them being balanced against each other. Fire is strong against wood, wood is strong against water, and water is strong against fire Light and dark are the other elements and are strong against each other. There are also heart orbs that when matched heal the party. Each team member also has a skill. Skills can be used after a certain number of enemy turns are made.

Defeating enemies earns the players team experience points which will level them up and make them stronger. Defeated enemies may also join the player's team. Also, items can be found while out battling enemies. The players creatures can be transformed to a stronger version by using these items.
title: Puzzle & Dragons: Super Mario Bros. Edition

description: 3D Ryōme de Unō o Kitaeru is an educational game featuring the likeness of Akihiro Kawamura, a Japanese researcher known for his research into speed-reading. Compared to earlier games in the series, this one is focused on minigames using the 3DS's 3D displays in order to teach speed-reading techniques.
title: 3D Ryōme de Unō o Kitaeru: Sokudoku Jutsu

description:
Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma☆Illya is a third-person shooter based on the manga/anime series of the same name. Set in an alternate continuity of the Fate series, the player controls Illyasviel von Einzbern, an elementary school student who is transformed into a magical girl after accidentally making a contract with the sentient Kaleidostick, Ruby. When Ruby refuses a command from her owner, Rin Tohsaka, to release Illya from her contract, Rin begrudgingly recruits Illya as her servant. Illya must put her new powers to the test when Rin sends her on a mission to collect the Class Cards, cards imbued with magical powers which are scattered around Fuyuki City - but Illya isn't the only one seeking the cards.

Throughout the game, the player collects different spell cards to form a deck to use in battles. These battles feature combat similar to Virtual-On, taking place against single opponents in 3D arenas. The player can switch between cards during battles, finding the right combination of spells to win. Most battles have a time limit of 60 seconds or more. In addition, the game features a multiplayer mode where up to four players can play against each other using their customized decks.
title: Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma☆Illya

description:
The Dragmeshia Continent is under attack by a group called Paradox. Paradox is led by Dogma, along with his accomplice Enigma, and its sub leaders who are collectively called Genius. They have tamed the elemental Sky Dragons, protectors of Dragmeshia, and are now removing large swathes of land which is creating havoc.

While in the capital Z-City, a rookie dragon tamer and friends Nick and Sarah run into a mysterious creature who they nickname Syrup. After an early run in with Paradox it is shown Syrup has mysterious powers so it is decided Syrup joins up with the rookie and they go an adventure to defeat Paradox.

Puzzle & Dragons Z is a tile-based puzzle game with combat. Before a battle begins players select their team, with a leader, and 4 other creature, plus an ally dragon tamer's creature. While the game uses tile-based matching, the game has a unique orb shifting gameplay element. Players can slide an orb to anywhere on the playfield in order to make a match or a combination of matches. Matching elements the same color as a team member lets that team member attack one enemy. Matching 5 of the same element lets a team member hit an entire group of enemies, If the player makes a large enough combo a Z-orb is created which when used in another combo will inflict more damage.

5 different orb elements exist, with them being balanced against each other. Fire is strong against wood, wood is strong against water, and water is strong against fire Light and dark are the other elements and are strong against each other. There are also heart orbs that when matched heal the party. Each team member also has a skill. Skills can be used after an ability meter is filled.

Defeating enemies earns the players team experience points which will level them up and make them stronger. Also, items can be found while out battling enemies. The player's creatures can be transformed to a stronger version by using these items.
title: Puzzle & Dragons Z
